Operation and functions of Minecraft – Pocket Edition

The principle of the game is simple: You are exposed to a large pixel world, which is peppered with trees, lakes, mountains and other landscapes. Everything consists of cube-shaped blocks. Now it’s up to you what you want to do. You can collect, mine or harvest any block in the world and then use it to build or craft something else. There is no limit to your imagination.


Finally, players of the Pocket and Windows 10 versions of Minecraft can get creative with the Redstone. (Source: Mojang)

After launching the game, you can choose to play in Survival Mode or Creative Mode. In survival mode, you are dropped in a randomly generated world and you have to make your way there.

Survival mode in Minecraft – Pocket Edition

A wide variety of characters and beings await you, who will either help you or make life a nightmare. Crafting allows you to create tools and other items to help you survive or furnish your own home. It is important to note that every block of the game world is degradable. So you can create a world like you’ve always dreamed of. Whether massive “terraforming” or a small hut in the forest – everything is possible.

Creative mode in Minecraft – Pocket Edition


Minecraft on Xbox. (Source: YouTube / XBox / Screenshot: netzwelt)

In the creative mode you are freed from the constant fear of monster attacks or starvation. Here you can fly over the landscape and have access to all items available in the game in an inventory selection. So you can easily implement your ideas without having to worry about raw materials or the production of specific tools. Plus, you’ll break down any block you’re aiming for with just a single hit.

Multiplayer in Minecraft – Pocket Edition

So that you don’t have to roam around in the big Minecraft world all by yourself, there is the option of exploring Pixelland together with friends via a WLAN network. The help from your friends will be very helpful to you. Because in order to explore the depths of the caves where the greatest treasures await you, you have to be armed against all kinds of opponents.

Our verdict on Minecraft – Pocket Edition

You can finally play Minecraft on iOS or Android devices. Although the Pocket Edition is still inferior to its twin on the PC in some functions, the basic structure is already recognizable and extensions are added to the app with every update. However, the control via the touchpad is still a bit cumbersome. The construction of large buildings can quickly become a test of patience.

Minecraft – Pocket Edition is the ideal supplement for fans on the go. Incidentally, the retro-look graphics look just as good on the smartphone as on the PC. Maybe the app will soon be able to compete with the PC game in every aspect. You can find similar games in our construction, economy and vehicle simulations.
